roleset.name: fill with the odor of

example.name: passive, no arg0
example.text: A scant half mile away Shelley and Mary were doubtless sitting on their diminutive terrace , the air about them scented with stock , and listening to the nightingale who [*T*-1] had nested in the big lime tree at the foot of the garden .

example.name: passive, arg1 only
example.text: Outside , the garden , the tame wilderness , yielded a patchwork bouquet of daisies , sweet william , scented stock and lady 's bedstraw , which she tied [*T*-2] with long grasses and took [*T*-2] back [*-3] to show Rosa , who [*T*-1] was now stirring about the kitchen and haranguing Folly .

roleset.note: Frame updated by Julia based on internet search and wordnet. Member of Vncls 9.9. Comparison to "perfume".

example.name: All arguments
example.text: We scented the room with a wood-burning fragrance.

example.name: Fragrance/theme as subject
example.text: His perfume scented the streets he walked through.

roleset.name: catch the scent of

role.descr: air or environment carrying the scent

roleset.note: Roleset based on internet search and wordnet. Added because absent. Member of Vncls 30.2, 35.3. Comparison to "smell". Roleset by Julia.

example.name: Intransitive
example.text: [The two dogs]-1 leaned against their harness, *trace*-1 scenting.

example.name: Transitive, with theme
example.text: He stood there like a stag scenting danger.

example.name: Transitive with location
example.text: The hell hound scented the air.

example.name: All arguments
example.text: [One animal]-1 stepped out and *trace*-1 scented the air for the strange smell of the new buffalo.
example.arg: for the strange smell of the new buffalo.

roleset.name: find by following the scent of

roles.note: Arg 2, source, not witness, nor is an example of it even given in this tier of the VN frame for any member verbs.

role.descr: source leading to the discovery of Arg 1

roleset.note: Roleset based on internet search and wordnet. Added because absent. Member of Vncls 30.2, 84. Comparison to "smell". Roleset by Julia.

example.name: Transitive
example.text: A rat has scented out my traveling-biscuits.

example.name: Direction, not source
example.text: The raven scented out the slaughter from afar.
